Job Title: Certified Welder II

Location: Hebron, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Who we are looking for:

We are currently searching for a Certified Welder to be based out of Hebron, OH. Reporting to the Manufacturing Supervisor, this person will be responsible for performing skilled MIG & TIG welding operations.

What you’ll do:

Additional Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Adhere to all Life Saving Rules, including: Lock-Out, Tag-Out (LOTO), Machine Guarding/Bypassing Safety Controls, and Powered Industrial Truck (PIT) safety protocolsPerform skilled MIG & TIG welding techniquePerform setup, adjustments and operation of welding machinesOperate an Angle Grinder to prepare parts for welding and to touch up surface defectsSet components for welding in accordance with set specifications and configuration and blueprintsDetermine the appropriate welding equipment or method needed based on the requirements of the jobResponsible for assessing welded surfaces, structures, and components to ensure weld accuracy and identify weld errorsReplace wire, filters, and gas cradles as neededMust perform First-Piece Inspection, as well as all required subsequent inspectionsResponsible for meeting and/or exceeding hourly rate goalsResponsible for completing the Hour-by-Hour board(s) for the duration of shift


What You’ll Bring

High School Diploma or GED equivalent plus three (3) years welding experience preferred.AWS Certification required or Technical School Welding CertificateAbility to follow standard work processes and operate with a continuous improvement mindsetFlexibility of shift scheduling, to include overtime and weekendsAbility to squat, bend and lift up to 50 lbs.Ability to stand and work a 10-hour shift in a non-climate-controlled manufacturing environmentMust be willing to work overtime as neededAll associates must embrace and foster an environment that supports our core values of Integrity, Respect, Excellence, Teamwork and Accountability.


Within 3 months, You’ll

Complete required trainingHave developed relationships with the key stakeholders for this roleDeveloped good communication skills to apply strong manufacturing guidelines with a strategic planning focusBe well-versed in Atkore’s Business System and the importance of your role to daily operations.


Who we are:

Atkore is a four-time Great Place to Work© certified company and a two-time Top Workplaces USA award winner! We’re committed to creating an engaged, aligned workforce driven by a collaborative culture. Our team strives for breakthrough results and stays focused on being standout leaders. We consistently live the Atkore mission, strategic priorities, and behaviors consistent with our core values.

Join our team and align yourself with an industry leader!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
